author: Special Correspondent
text:
A metallic object that got deposited in the lung of a boy eight years ago, was successfully removed through a surgery by a team of doctors of Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital here.

Venkatesan (13), son of Subramanian of Rakkipatti village in Taramangalam block was suffering from breathing problem for many years. The treatment he got on various occasions for the last eight years could not bring him relief.

The boy was recently admitted to the Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital. A scan proved the presence of metallic object at the bottom of the right lung.

P. Kanagaraj, Dean of the hospital, formed a nine-member special team to perform the surgery on him. The team led by E. Srinivasan, and Ponrajarajan performed the surgery successfully.
title: Metallic object removed from lung
